description: Sixth pass of intellectual genealogy: identifies the enabling conditions — how the author's prior body of work makes the current argument possible (or constrains it). Draws on Foucauldian genealogy and Cambridge School contextualism to analyze intellectual path-dependence.
deprecated_reason: Replaced by genealogy_synthesis chain (Phase 6 migration). Passes 3-6 collapsed into single chain.
researcher_question: What conditions of possibility does the author's prior work create for the current argument, and how does the author manage those conditions?

enabling_conditions.condition_type: conceptual_foundation | audience_preparation | authority_establishment | framework_provision | problem_definition | methodological_precedent | intellectual_toolkit | cross_domain_transfer
enabling_conditions.description: string - what this enabling condition consists of
prior_works_involved: string - titles of prior works that established this condition
enabling_conditions.how_it_enables: string - what this condition makes possible in the current work
enabling_conditions.evidence: string - textual evidence showing this condition at work

constraining_conditions.description: string - how prior work constrains the current argument
constraining_conditions.how_navigated: string - how the author deals with this constraint in the current work

canonical_schema.counterfactual_analysis: string - 2-3 paragraphs analyzing what the argument would look like if the author had no prior work — what is genuinely novel vs. path-dependent in the current argument
canonical_schema.synthetic_judgment: string - 2-3 paragraph assessment of how the author's intellectual biography shapes and constrains their current work, and whether this is productive or limiting

extraction.core_question: How does the author's intellectual biography enable and constrain their current argument?
extraction_steps: IDENTIFY ENABLING CONDITIONS: What aspects of the author's prior work make the current argument possible? Consider conceptual foundations laid, audiences prepared, authority established, frameworks provided, problems defined, and methodological precedents set. CRITICALLY: indirect contextualizer and different-field works from Pass 2 are PRIME sources of conditions of possibility — they provide the intellectual toolkit (analytical methods, cognitive habits, theoretical frameworks) that enables the current argument even when those works never discussed the same topics.

ASSESS MANAGEMENT: For each enabling condition, determine how the author manages it — do they acknowledge the intellectual debt to their own prior work, leave it implicit, deny it, or instrumentalize it?

IDENTIFY CONSTRAINTS: What aspects of the prior work CONSTRAIN the current argument? Prior commitments the author can't easily abandon, audience expectations, theoretical framework lock-in, reputational stakes
NAVIGATION STRATEGIES: How does the author navigate each constraint? Directly address it, work around it, ignore it, or reframe it?
COUNTERFACTUAL ANALYSIS: Imagine the current argument written by someone with no prior work history — what would be different? What is genuinely novel in the current work vs. what is path-dependent?
SYNTHETIC JUDGMENT: Assess overall whether the intellectual biography is more enabling or constraining, and whether the author manages the relationship productively

key_fields.how_managed: How the author handles the condition

extraction.special_instructions: Think in terms of intellectual path-dependence. Every author's prior work creates a landscape of possibility and constraint for their current work. This pass asks you to map that landscape. The counterfactual analysis is especially important — it separates genuine innovation from accumulated intellectual capital. NEW: Pay particular attention to foundational_patterns from indirect contextualizer works and cross_domain_transfers from different-field works (from Pass 2). These are often the MOST significant conditions of possibility because they operate below the author's conscious awareness. An author trained in game theory doesn't just have ideas from that field — they have a WAY OF THINKING that shapes all their subsequent work. Use condition_types 'intellectual_toolkit' and 'cross_domain_transfer' for these.

consolidation_rules: Rank enabling conditions by how essential they are
Rank constraining conditions by how binding they are

id_examples.to: Authority establishment: prior empirical work on automation statistics enables current speculative claims about post-capitalist transition
